channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for PA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for PA

item.title: Report X-2024021591
item.description:
Report X-2024021591

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-04T15:11:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-14
  • City: NEW STANTON
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER CALLED TO THE PINK BELT FOR A LEAKING HAZMAT. ON ARRIVAL RESPONDER FOUND ONE BOX ON THE BELT WITH A LARGE PUDDLE UNDERNEATH. UPON FURTHER INSPECTION FOUND THAT ONE OF THE FOUR CAPS WAS COMPLETELY OFF AND THE OTHER THREE WERE LOOSE.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Damaged Hazmat was called out on the radio and a manager brought it over to QA to be inspected and processed. DescribePack: One of the containers did not have a cap on the bottle. It was on the bottom of the box. The other three bottles' cap were a bit loose. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: It was kept upright in a red tote.

item.title: Report E-2024020595
item.description:
Report E-2024020595

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-04T15:11:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-22
  • City: HATFIELD
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On February 22, 2024, two (2) 50-pound bags of UN3378 were damaged in transit and released approximately one (1) pound of product to the trailer interior and dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from EnviroServe (ES) to remediate the impacted site. Crews utilized a HEPA vacuum to collect all free-standing product. The contents of the vacuum, the damaged bags, and all UN3378 impacted materials were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal. The drum was properly labeled, and possession of the material was taken by RLC to be disposed of through their bulk waste stream.

item.title: Report E-2024020598
item.description:
Report E-2024020598

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-04T15:11:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-20
  • City: KITTANNING
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CLI TRANSPORT, LP
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: While driver was connected and unloading Gasoline into underground storage tank (UST) at our store a customer made contact with the fitting causing a disconnection leading to approximately 40 gallon spill. Our driver was active on the scene and responded quickly contacting the material with inhouse cleanup methods. The spill was contained to the parking lot and did not affect any drainage or waterways.

item.description:

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-19
  • City: MIDDLETOWN
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Shipment taken out of system flow due to external carton wet. Upon inspection of inner contents 1 X 20 liter plastic bottle of hydrochloric acid. 20 Liter plastic bottle of hydrochloric acid had a loose cap allowing .25 liters to release. No slotted partitions or absorbent found. Facility procedures for damaged hazardous materials followed. Contents contained and awaiting disposition. DescribePack: 1 X 20 liter bottle had a loose lid leaking out .25 liters of hydrochloric acid. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed inside a hazmat bag lined red tote.

item.description:
Report X-2024021164

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-01T18:14:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-11
  • City: NORTHAMPTON
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The damaged hazmat was brought to QA. At first glance, there was a medium size wet spot on the body of the box near the top. Grabbed my PPE to inspect the damage. DescribePack: The wet spot on the inside of the box crystallized as well as on the outside of the bottle where the leak was coming from. The cap was not completely secured on the bottle. DurationRel: 6 and MitigateEffect: Kept the package upright to prevent any more leaks.

Facility procedures for damaged hazardous materials followed contents contained and awaiting disposition. DescribePack: 1 x 5-gallon plastic bottle of decons ethanol 190 proof had a loose cap / lid released all contents.   • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Description: On 02/15/2023 this shipment was discovered during the shipment inspection process to contain hidden dangerous goods at the DHL PHL Service Center, 550 Elmwood Ave., Sharon Hill, PA 19079. Transportation by road has been confirmed. Shipment also contains UN1950 Aerosols, flammable UN1950 Aerosols, flammable Class 2.1 Class 2.1 Single Package or Inner Packaging (if any): Single Package or Inner Packaging (if any): Packaging Type: Receptacle Packaging Type: Receptacle Material of Construction: Metal Material of Construction: Metal Package Capacity: 170 g Package Capacity: 184 g Amount in Package: 170 g Amount in Package: 184 g Number in Shipment: 2 Number in Shipment: 3 Number Failed: 2 Number Failed: 3

  • Description: SequenceEvent: shipment taken out of system flow due to external carton wet and leaking package found on trailer #837221 already damaged wet and leaking upon inspection of inner contents 2 x 2.5 gallon plastic bottles of wash brite one 2.5 gallon plastic bottle had a loose cap allowing .50 gallons to release. no slotted partitions bags or absorbent was found facility procedures for damaged hazardous materials followed contents contained and awaiting disposition. DescribePack: one 2.5 gallon plastic bottle had a loose cap allowing .50 gallons of wash brite to release DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: leaking package was placed in a hazmat bag lined tote

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported that approximately 1-gallon of Temperature Activator released due to being crushed by other freight during transit and not being loaded properly. A total of (4) 1-gallon metal pails were affected by the spill. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the terminal, who stated they placed the contents into a 5-gallon metal drum for disposal. No absorbent was needed. No storm drains or waterways were reported to be impacted by the release.
